intro: Centaurea kermanshahensis, commonly known as Kermanshah thistle, is a flowering plant native to Iran. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its spiny leaves and purple to pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showing adaptations to drought and poor soil conditions. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces spherical, yellowish flower heads. Centaurea kermanshahensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited geographic distribution.
